name: water-leaper

attributes.attribute: drags prey underwater to eat it

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A water-dwelling creature known as the water-leaper, or llamhigyn y dwr in Welsh folklore, is said to have similar habits to that of the Water Bull and Water Horse. This monster, resembling a giant toad, would lay in wait in the water until it found a suitable target, whether it be a human or animal. It would then emerge from the water and seize its prey in order to devour it submerged beneath the surface.
